page.title: 03UNUSUAL BUILDINGS-FOXTON
page.content: Foxton has one church called ST.ANDREWS.It is a Church of England denomination and was built in Saxon times.The old chapel was sold in 1984 and was bought and converted into an art studio. Following the arrival of the prison in 1967 Foxton County Primary School was built to replace the old village school.The old school is now a field centre and used as a residential training base for people studying the canal. Gumley church is called St. Helen's. There is a museum at Gumley.It is the old butcher's house and is preserved as it was in Victorian times.
